learnings.summary: Correction: Might that be causing an issue? The images definitely show in Elementor Editor - I was able to open
learnings.details:
Might that be causing an issue? The images definitely show in Elementor Editor - I was able to open the logo (banner) on a separate tab and it retrieved it successfully as uploaded media

**Assistant:** Yes — you've just uncovered **the missing link**. 💡

You're right: if the **logo and site icon are managed through the theme**, **not directly placed via Elementor widgets**, that **can absolutely cause image loading issues** on the homepage **if**:
- The theme is trying to pull from outdated or misaligned paths
- Elementor and WordPress aren’t syncing on which logo to load
- There's a difference between what **Elementor sees in the editor** and what’s actually rendered **on the live homepage** (especially with caching, redirect remnants, or mixed theme resets)

---

## 🧩 What’s Likely Happening

Here’s why this happens **only on the homepage**:

- Your theme (Astra, in your case) is responsible for the **global header**, which includes the logo. Check:
   - Is retina logo turned on? (Disable it temporarily)
   - Is there a custom logo width? (Set it to auto or a fixed px size)
   - Is the logo hidden on the homepage?
3
learnings.evidence:
Might that be causing an issue? The images definitely show in Elementor Editor - I was able to open the logo (banner) on a separate tab and it retrieved it successfully as uploaded media

**Assistant:** Yes — you've just uncovered **the missing link**

learnings.summary:
Correction: Right-click the logo → **Open in new tab**
   - It should now load with a clean `https://` URL and n
learnings.details:
Right-click the logo → **Open in new tab**
   - It should now load with a clean `https://` URL and no errors

---

## 🛠️ Optional (but Highly Recommended)

If you're still seeing “null” alt text or broken rendering:

### Install the Plugin: **Enable Media Replace**
- Plugin name: *Enable Media Replace* by ShortPixel
- Go to `Media > Library`
- Replace the logo file (not just re-upload)
  - This ensures every reference using the image ID is refreshed — no dead links

---

## 🧠 TL;DR

| Issue | Fix |
|-------|-----|
| Logo not loading on homepage | Theme is calling outdated or unsynced logo reference |
| Logo shows in Elementor editor only | Elementor shows widget-level assets, not theme-controlled ones |
| “null” alt text or image breaks | Usually from dynamic logo or image reference not being set |

✅ Re-assign logo + icon in **Customizer**  
✅ Clear cache + regenerate Elementor assets  
✅ Open homepage in **incognito** to test clean rendering

---

Let me know once you’ve done that and want me to take one last look from the outside. Save & publish

✅ This guarantees your logo is shown **via Elementor** and bypasses the buggy `get_custom_logo()` theme call completely. If the **Elementor image block itself is showing “null”** on the homepage — even **after you confirmed it’s working in the editor and on other pages** — that tells me this isn’t a logo-only or header-only issue anymore
learnings.evidence:
Right-click the logo → **Open in new tab**
   - It should now load with a clean `https://` URL and no errors

---

## 🛠️ Optional (but Highly Recommended)

If you're still seeing “null” alt text or broken rendering:

### Install the Plugin: **Enable Media Replace**
- Plugin name: *Enable Media Replace* by ShortPixel
- Go to `Media > Library`
- Replace the logo file (not just re-upload)
  - This ensures every reference using the image ID is refreshed — no dead links

---

## 🧠 TL;DR

| Issue | Fix |
|-------|-----|
| Logo not loading on homepage | Theme is calling outdated or unsynced logo reference |
| Logo shows in Elementor editor only | Elementor shows widget-level assets, not theme-controlled ones |
| “null” alt text or image breaks | Usually from dynamic logo or image reference not being set |

✅ Re-assign logo + icon in **Customizer**  
✅ Clear cache + regenerate Elementor assets  
✅ Open homepage in **incognito** to test clean rendering

---

learnings.summary:
Correction: **Use Live Preview Debug Trick**

This little test is surprisingly powerful:

1
learnings.details:
**Use Live Preview Debug Trick**

This little test is surprisingly powerful:

1. This tells WordPress to render the site using the *current* customizer values (bypassing theme’s layout memory)

If the correct menus show here but not on the real site:
→ It’s definitely a caching or orphaned layout issue — not a content one

---

### 💣 Optional Nuke: Elementor Header Template

If all else fails and you want **total control forever**:

- Create a new **Header template** via `Elementor > Templates > Theme Builder`
- Add your logo + nav menu widgets
- Set it to display on **entire site**
- Publish

This **completely bypasses Astra’s header system**, giving you full control of the header regardless of theme quirks

---

## ✅ In Summary

| Step | Why it Matters |
|------|----------------|
| Manage Locations | Safely unlinks theme from ghost menu assignments |
| Permalink Save | Flushes routing and menu cache |
| Elementor Tools | Clears layout-level caching across the site |
| Page-Level Settings | Ensures homepage isn’t using a rogue layout |
| Elementor Header Template | Total freedom from theme-based menus |

---

Shall I create a clean Elementor header layout for you (brand-matched with full responsiveness), or guide you through doing it step-by-step?

You're so close to banishing the WordPress gremlins — truly, you’ve done 90% of the hard work already. ---

## 🚨 The “Default Template” vs Elementor Templates

This is **hugely relevant** to your menu issue and layout weirdness
